name: Pandavkada Waterfall
description: Pandavkada Waterfall is a plunge-type waterfall located in Kharghar, a suburb of Navi Mumbai. It cascades from a height of about 107 meters through the Western Ghats, surrounded by lush greenery. The waterfall is named after the Pandavas, who according to legend, visited the site during their exile. It is popular during the monsoon season for its spectacular flow and natural beauty, attracting trekkers and nature lovers alike.

startingPoint.name: Kharghar Railway Station / Central Park Area
facilities: Local shops and tea stalls near entry
startingPoint.description: The trail to Pandavkada Waterfall begins from the Kharghar area near Central Park and requires a moderate trek through forested rocky terrain. The approach is accessible via road and local transport.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: Dial 108 or 112 if network is available

restaurants: Local tea stalls and snack vendors near Kharghar
shops: General stores selling packaged water and snacks
waterSources: No potable water; carry your own water supply

foodOptions: No food stalls; visitors should bring their own snacks and water
waterSources: Natural pools and streams (not safe for drinking)

camping.reason: No designated camping areas; overnight stay not permitted

nearbyStays.name: Navi Mumbai Hotels and Guesthouses
facilities: Various accommodation options available with food and transport

permits.notes: No official permits required; visitors access the area at their own risk.

commonRisks: Slippery rocks and rugged trail, especially during monsoon
Strong currents and deep water near waterfall base
Past drowning incidents have led to warnings
No lifeguard or designated safe swimming areas
precautions: Do not swim near the falls, especially during heavy water flow
Wear sturdy trekking shoes with good grip
Follow local police and forest department guidelines

byTrain.description: Take Central Line train to Kharghar station, then walk or take rickshaw to waterfall trailhead
steps: Board train from Mumbai CST/Dadar to Kharghar
Exit station and proceed by foot or rickshaw towards Central Park area

byBus.description: Local buses run toward Kharghar; from bus stops proceed to waterfall access trail
steps: Take local bus to Kharghar area
Walk or take rickshaw to waterfall trailhead

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive via Eastern Express Highway and Sion-Panvel Expressway to Kharghar
steps: Park in designated parking and proceed to waterfall trail

byTrain.description: Train from Pune to Panvel, then switch to local train towards Kharghar

byBus.description: MSRTC buses from Pune to Panvel/Kharghar, then local transport
steps: Walk or take local transport to waterfall base

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive Pune to Kharghar via Expressway and National Highways
steps: Park and proceed to waterfall trail

bestTimeToVisit: June to September (monsoon season) for best waterfall flow; October to December for pleasant weather
